result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryant A Hunt-Haynes

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bryant A Hunt-Haynes in court.  Attorney Mark A Leonard in court for Bryant A Hunt-Haynes.  Attorney Kyle Olsen in court for State of Wisconsin. Defn has new charges set for I/A on 10/17. Case to track with new case.
Pre-trial conference on October 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Bryant A Hunt-Haynes in court.  Attorney Mark A Leonard in court for Bryant A Hunt-Haynes.  Attorney Kyle Olsen in court for State of Wisconsin. Defn rec'd an offer but request more time to consider offer with employer. CT sets another PTC.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Pre-trial conference on August 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Defendant appeared.  Tim Helmberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn applied for SPD earlier this week and qualifies; SPD confirmed. CT to set PTC once SPD appoints counsel.
Pre-trial conference on June 24, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Defendant appeared.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn failed to apply for CDP; defn advised he never rec'd disqualification paperwork from SPD. CT directs defn to go to SPD f/w and obtain the paperwork. Defn directed to apply for CDP prior to the next CT date. CT advises if defn fails to obtain counsel by the next court date, the CT will find defn is waiving his right to an atty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)].  
Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.
  Trial Judge - Br 5

09:35 AM Defendant appeared.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
